intro: Hieracium runcinatum, commonly known as the hooked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are usually shorter than the disk florets, and it produces small, oval achenes as seeds. Hieracium runcinatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
